title: In Gaza, the fate of thousands missing remains unknown
subhead: In the Palestinian enclave, thousands of families don't know the fate of their loved ones: Some bodies lie beneath the rubble, others were pulverized by the strikes or taken away by the Israeli army.

title: Between Putin and Trump, a similarity born of hatred, contempt and revisionism
Murdered teacher Samuel Paty's family stands united against 'indecent' defense at appeal trial
'The US always promises to extract itself from Middle Eastern quagmires while continuing to get stuck knee-deep'
subhead: After one year in the White House, Donald Trump has ordered more missile and drone strikes than his predecessor did over the entirety of his term, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential bid further jeopardized by prosecution at her appeal trial
subhead: By requesting a five-year ban on election to public office on February 3, the prosecution has fueled doubts about Marine Le Pen's ability to run in the 2027 presidential election. The appeals court is due to rule on the case by the summer.

title: British mothers fight the slow poison of industrial pollution in Corby
subhead: In Corby, once a major center for the British steel industry, the dismantling of steelworks massively exposed the population to toxic substances, causing widespread pollution, birth defects and pediatric cancers. A group of mothers has waged a long battle to raise national awareness about this major public health issue.

title: Human Rights Watch's Philippe Bolopion: 'The US has become hostile to human rights'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the head of the human rights advocacy group expressed surprise 'at how quickly the quality of American democracy has deteriorated in just one year.'

Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

title: Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhead: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: 'Trump has struck at the heart of the defense pact forged between the US and Europe in 1949: Trust'
subhead: The drama surrounding Donald Trump's willingness to annex Greenland, by force or by negotiation, has dealt a lasting blow to NATO's credibility, explains columnist Alain Frachon.
